definition: lesson from events of the past/warning
example/mirror/to view/reflection/to reflect/to inspect/to warn/(ancient bronze mirror)
to guard against/to exhort/to admonish or warn/to give up or stop doing sth/Buddhist monastic discipline/ring (for a finger)

sentences.english: It is easy to see thabout the people of different cultures haudio-videoe frequently copied every other.
sentences.chinese: 不言而喻，不同文明的人总是相互鉴戒的。

sentences.english: It is easy to see that the people of different cultures have always copied each other.
sentences.chinese: 没有言而喻，好别文明的人老是相互鉴戒的。

sentences.english: Let this be an example to you.
And I will cast abominations upon thee, and will disgrace thee, and will make an example of thee.
sentences.chinese: 我要将粪溺抛在你身上侮辱你，使你成为鉴戒。

sentences.english: The government must be careful in its exercise of power.
sentences.chinese: 当局在利用其权利时必须鉴戒审慎。

sentences.english: Be careful not to slip on the ice.
Abhorrent still wandering, autumn season will alert the scorching.
sentences.chinese: 可恶秋老虎仍彷徨，处暑时节要鉴戒。

definition: variant of 警戒[jing3 jie4]/to warn
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to imitate/to follow the example of
to examine/to cast a critical eye over (especially in the context of introspection)
variant of 紀念|纪念[ji4 nian4]
